reviewText: Wife loves having this series on disc now.

I can still say it was good for an anime made in it's time.  Saw some of it don't know then again I might have been on something at the time good if you are into something like this.  Still it has some promise.

It was worth its purchases, and seen the smile on her face made it seen like a never ending gift.
Quality and sound are great great, do its not for the big screen tvs it does well.

A little bit of everything. Over-top goofy action, huge eyes, problem solving, and chivalry. A fun show.

Its a little difficult to identify the main characters as boys sometimes, but they ARE.

This colection of Clamp School Detectives only gets better with time, even if this story is not a deep or depressing story like X or Tokyo Babylon the hand of the Clamp writers is obviously here, from the amazing design of the story to the beloved characters created this stories are funny, sweet, romantic and full of adventure.

On of my favorite anime ever.

The kingdom of Clamp has been extremely well known in Japan. (I am not so sure if it is also well known internationally.) It is true that its present works make changes from its previous production. However, I doubt anyone, especially fans of Clamp would forget the original character designs (pointy eye lashes, facial profile, etc) in the early 90s (late 80s - early 90s). Clamp's reputation is not something that is granted. Its early animation developed a new trend of animation in Japan. Its fairy tales, characters' design are unforgettable. Talking about its early production, these 3 lovely and smart `'''''''''' (little rich boys) are one of the icons in Clamp anime. It is very interesting to watch. The stories are relaxing. The characters are in children's bodies but with adults' characteristic. In addition, the production design is beautifully made.
